Services: Miracle Hill Ministries helps the homeless. Below is a list of shelters in Greenville County.
Greenville Rescue Mission is an emergency shelter for men that provide shelter from the danger of living on the streets.
Support is offered to women who are homeless. They offer food, shelter and spiritual counseling.
Offer services to keep children safe and support families in crisis through prevention, assessment and intervention. Also have a shelter for young people between 17-24 years old who are homeless.

Emergency shelter for homeless people in a clean, safe and comfortable environment. Residents are offered three meals per day, personal hygiene items, clothing and referral to other agencies based on individual assessment. Temporary assistance to transient, chronically at-risk, and homeless individuals in Greenville County.

title_en: The Salvation Army Woman and Children Hostel
post_content: Emergency shelter for homeless people in a clean, safe and comfortable environment. Residents are offered three meals per day, personal hygiene items, clothing and referral to other agencies based on individual assessment. Case management dedicated to helping people living in poverty to connect to the resources they need. They have drug and/or alcohol rehabilitation programs, food, beds and showers for homeless people.

This shelter allows families with children to stay together while homeless

Place of Hope provides basic services to homeless people. Walk-ins can receive basic services such as access to showers, bathrooms, laundry services, lockers, and the telephone. They also offer assistance with obtaining identification documents, securing treatment for substance abuse or mental health issues, securing long-term housing, obtaining legal services, and more.

Therapeutic treatment center for children. They offer therapeutic child care, individual therapy, family therapy, and home visits to help children with their transition to an educational or child care setting.
Disaster relief, services to the armed forces, international services, youth club, health and safety.

Children’s health services. The Center offers annual wellness visits, urgent care, evening appointments and weekend appointments. Offer classes and events to support patients.

Free diabetes self-management support program for people living with type 1 or type 2 diabetes. Participants learn how to manage their diabetes, healthy eating, physical activity, medications and monitoring. Classes available online in Spanish and English.

title_en: Department of Health and Environmental Control (SC DHEC)
post_content: Multiple services and programs; not all services are available at all sites; Contact the Health Department for services offered on site. Most services are based on a sliding fee scale, down to zero, but some services, such as Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) Program, are provided at no cost. Any type of identification may be required for certain services, such as Vital and Environmental Records; WIC does not require identification. Please check with the program when scheduling your appointment.
